title: Survivor star Luke Toki has been announced as a host of the new All Stars season
text:
Australian Survivor star Luke Toki has been named as a host for the new All Stars series to air from February 2020.

According to a report by Now to Love, the hunky fan favourite will host a digital and social media show for the popular series.

At Network Ten's Upfronts in Sydney, the network also revealed the eight contestants who have been confirmed for the series.

Host: Survivor star Luke Toki has been announced as a host of the new All Stars season...as eight new castaways have been announced for the show at Network Ten's Upfronts event

A second season of the regular Survivor Australia format is also scheduled to air from July 2020.

Channel 10 released the names of the first eight contestants who will appear on the All Star series with a number of surprises.

Male model David Genat, who last appeared on Champions V Contenders, will appear on the series. Footballer Matty Rodgers will also appear.

REVEALED: Channel Ten unveiled the first eight cast members of the series

Fan boy! Season one super-fan Nick Iadanza is returning to the show, four years after competing on season one

Season one super-fan Nick Iadanza is returning to the show, four years after competing on the inaugural series.

Flick Egginton, Phoebe Timmins, and Brooke Jowett, who are also from season one, have been announced as return entrants for the show.

Season two stars Henry Nicholson and Mark Herlaar have also been confirmed as stars of All Stars spin-off.

Blondes have more fun! Season one's strategic villains Phoebe Timmins (L) and Flick Egginton (R) are also back

Social media show: According to a report by Now to Love, the hunky fan favourite Luke (pictured) will host a digital and social media show for the popular series

Luke came in fourth during the last season of Survivor, meaning he missed out on the $500,000 prize money.

In earlier episodes, the FIFO worker revealed he planned to use the money for his family including his two sons, Lennox and Nate, who are on the autism spectrum.

He has a daughter, Madeline, was born with cystic fibrosis along with along with intestinal atresia (a blockage or obstruction in the intestine).

He's eviction saw an outpouring of support, which viewers starting a GoFundMe account and raising $550,000.

Appearing on The Project last month, Luke said: 'It's extremely humbling,' he told the hosts, before saying: 'Much love to everyone that's donated.'

Luke said he will use the money to pay off their family home's mortgage and his children's ongoing medical bills.
description: Australian Survivor star Luke Toki has been named as the host of the new All Stars series to be launched by Channel Ten later this year.
authors: Caleb Taylor For Daily Mail Australia
